intro: Pterichis tomentosula, commonly known as the woolly pterichis, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. Its unique appearance and restricted habitat make it a notable species in Hawaiian botany. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
